intro: Coelanthus amplificatus, commonly known as the broad-leaved bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It features striking bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Coelanthus amplificatus is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to naturalize in suitable climates.
